meanings.definition: Relating to the study of bones.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted an osteological examination of the ancient skeleton.
meanings.sent2: The osteological research helped identify the age of the fossilized remains.
meanings.sent3: The detective's osteological skills were put to the test in solving the mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her osteological expertise was crucial in determining the species of the unearthed bones.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed an impressive collection of osteological specimens.

meanings.definition: Involving the structure and function of bones.
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended an osteological assessment to understand the patient's bone health.
meanings.sent2: An osteological analysis revealed the impact of the injury on the skeletal system.
meanings.sent3: The chef's recipe had an osteological twist, incorporating bone broth for added flavor.
meanings.sent4: The building's osteological framework provided strength and support to the entire structure.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's training regimen focused on osteological strength for better performance.
